summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing the status of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, specifically regarding a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request submitted in April 2020 and the intention of New York prosecutors to speak with Prince Andrew. The emails indicate that the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was still reviewing digital evidence.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; New York prosecutors have asked to speak with him as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: MLAT Request Submission
events.description: A Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request related to the Epstein investigation was submitted.

events.title: Internal FBI Discussion on Investigation Status
events.description: FBI agents in New York discuss the status of the Epstein investigation, including the MLAT request and SDNY's review of digital evidence.

keyFacts: Prosecutors in New York had asked to speak with Prince Andrew in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation as of June 2020.
A Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request related to the case was submitted in April 2020.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) was, at the time of this email, still reviewing digital evidence in the case.
The document is an internal FBI email chain, indicating coordination and status updates within the bureau regarding the high-profile investigation.
